item.title: Instinct Can Beat Analytical Thinking
item.description:
Instinct Can Beat Analytical Thinking

Researchers have confronted us in recent years with example after example of how we humans get things wrong when it comes to making decisions. We misunderstand probability, we're myopic, we pay attention to the wrong things, and we just generally mess up.

item.title: Power Suits: How Dressing For Success At Work Can Pay Off
item.description:
Power Suits: How Dressing For Success At Work Can Pay Off

What does it mean to "dress for success"? Certainly not what it meant when a book by that name first came out in 1975. Now, what to wear to work is a murky area that includes a new clothing trend known as "athleisure" - workout wear that might also work for the office.

item.title: The One Big Reason To Every Business Needs Embrace Complexity
item.description:
The One Big Reason To Every Business Needs Embrace Complexity

Managers need to embrace complexity. Not because it will make their enterprise more efficient-it won't-but because that's what will allow them to create maximum value in an increasingly complex marketplace.

item.title: These Are the Most Motivational Books Ever Written
item.description:
These Are the Most Motivational Books Ever Written

Three years ago, I identified the " Top 10 Motivational Books of All Time," but with a twist: I left the No. 1 spot blank and asked Inc.com readers to name their favorite. In hundreds of comments, our readers named almost 300 books, but there were 18 that turned up consistently.

item.title: Tips to Improve Interaction Among the Generations - Tomorrow Trends
item.description:
Tips to Improve Interaction Among the Generations - Tomorrow Trends

It seems that just about everyone is talking about generations and how to manage the mix of generations in the office these days. I was sent this interesting summary of generational values from the National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Association Office of Diversity (USA) which was released by them in 2008.

item.title: 5 Reasons To Kill The Work-Life Balance Myth
item.description:
5 Reasons To Kill The Work-Life Balance Myth

Work or life? Nope. There's no such thing as either/or. The work-life duality is a fallacy. One way or another, we all know, deep down, that it's simply not a functional construct, particularly in 2016. Here are five reasons why. 1. Passion is seamless If we're engaged in our work, we're working [...]

item.title: How Is Gen Z Using Social Media?
item.description:
How Is Gen Z Using Social Media?

Generation Z is starting to come into its own and distinguishing itself from other generations. Very often we hear talk about millennials using social sites, but Gen Z should be your focus if you're trying to capture viewers and users in emerging markets.

item.title: The suddenly exciting future of enterprise communications
item.description:
The suddenly exciting future of enterprise communications

Enterprise communications is not a sector that typically generates palpable excitement. In the enterprise, the plumbing is never as exciting as the fixtures, and people spend more time noticing what communications enables than how it's delivered. It doesn't help that enterprise communications is often dismissed as slow to innovate, given its high capital costs to deploy new infrastructure and natural monopolies.
